body_html:
Thanks @wangshuaizs

Indeed GID index 2 is what you for going RoCEv1 on the VLAN network.
When running the ib_write_bw (where it worked), did you set the SL to 4 (-S flag I think) ?
You can try here to set the RDMA_QP_SL=4 and see if that works for you.
When using VLANs, usually the QP SL is used to configure the VLAN PCP.
Tell me if that works for you.

body:
Thanks @wangshuaizs 

Indeed GID index 2 is what you for going RoCEv1 on the VLAN network.
When running the ib_write_bw (where it worked), did you set the SL to 4 (-S flag I think) ?
You can try here to set the RDMA_QP_SL=4 and see if that works for you.
When using VLANs, usually the QP SL is used to configure the VLAN PCP.
Tell me if that works for you.
